name: Khanqah Maner Sharif
founderName: Hazrat Shaikh Sharfuddin Ahmad Yahya Maneri R.H
principalSajjadaNashin: Currently held by the family descendants
description: The founder of the Khanqah Maner Sharif in Bihar is Hazrat Momin Arif, who settled there in 1180 AD. His son, Hazrat Shaah Kamaluddin Ahmad Yahya Maneri, is also significant, known as Makhdoom-ul-Mulk and a prominent Sufi saint who propagated the Firdusia Silsila sect. The Khanqah is a revered site for both Hindus and Muslims, known for its historical and spiritual importance in Bihar.

name: Khanqah Moazzam
principalSajjadaNashin: Managed by the Khanqah Committee
description: Located in the heart of Bihar, the Khanqah Moazzam is a significant spiritual center of the Chishti Order. It is known for its beautiful architecture and spiritual atmosphere.

name: Khanqah Hazrat Miran Bheek
founderName: Miran Syed Shah Qutb Alam Urf Miran Bheek
principalSajjadaNashin: Currently held by the family descendants
address: Miran Bigha, Tekari, South Bihar, India - 824236
description: An important Khanqah of Qadria Silsila in Bihar, established in 1100 AH. It has been a center of spiritual learning and practice for centuries.

name: Khanqah Mujeebia
principalSajjadaNashin: Currently held by the family descendants
description: A historic Khanqah in Bihar, the Khanqah at Mujeebia has been instrumental in preserving the spiritual traditions of the Saadat-e-Mujeebia lineage.

principalSajjadaNashin: Currently held by the family descendants
description: An important spiritual center in Bihar, the Khanqah at Deora continues the traditions of the Saadat-e-Kamaliya family and serves as a beacon of spiritual guidance.

name: Khanqah Chishtiya Munemia
principalSajjadaNashin: Currently held by the family descendants
description: Khanqah Munemia Gaya is a significant spiritual center in the Gaya district of Bihar, India. It is associated with Hazrat Munim Pak, a revered Sufi saint, and serves as a symbol of communal harmony and brotherhood. The Khanqah is known for its spiritual gatherings, where devotees come to seek guidance and blessings from the saints. It emphasizes love, unity, and humility, welcoming people of all faiths to participate in its teachings and community service. The Khanqah is also a place where the Sufi tradition continues to flourish, offering spiritual fulfillment and community support.
